bibl.title: The Town of Syene. Report on the 7th Season in Aswan.
bibl.note: Overview. - I. Roman tombs and medieval houses (Area 30). - II. The eastern outskirts of the medieval and early islamic town. - III. The southern outskirts of Syene / Aswan from Pharaonic to medieval times (Area 32.) - IV. A city quarter in the early Islamic to medieval periods (Area 33.) - V. Roman cemetery succeded by an early Islamic and medieval quarter. - VI. Ptolemaic and late period structures at the eastern limit of Syene. - VII. Lithic finds from Area 23. - VIII. A Greek inscription from area 13 c. [The inscription speaks of θυασῖται, members of a religious association, and of a banqueting room, which the men listed probably helped to build through donations.] - IX. Ergebnisse der anthropologisch-paläopathologischen Untersuchung der römerzeitlichen und frühmittelalterlichen Skeletfunde.
bibl.seg: von Pilgrim Cornelius, Rick Colman, Wolfgang Müller, Jan Niacek, Axel de Pontbriand and Michael Schultz, in collaboration with Mohamed el-Bialy and Mohi ed-Din Mustafa, The Town of Syene. Report on the 7th Season in Aswan.

Overview. - I. Roman tombs and medieval houses (Area 30). - II. The eastern outskirts of the medieval and early islamic town. - III. The southern outskirts of Syene / Aswan from Pharaonic to medieval times (Area 32.) - IV. A city quarter in the early Islamic to medieval periods (Area 33.) - V. Roman cemetery succeded by an early Islamic and medieval quarter. - VI. Ptolemaic and late period structures at the eastern limit of Syene. - VII. Lithic finds from Area 23. - VIII. A Greek inscription from area 13 c. [The inscription speaks of θυασῖται, members of a religious association, and of a banqueting room, which the men listed probably helped to build through donations.] - IX. Ergebnisse der anthropologisch-paläopathologischen Untersuchung der römerzeitlichen und frühmittelalterlichen Skeletfunde.
von Pilgrim Colman Müller Niacek Pontbriand Schultz el-Bialy Mustafa
